image.altText: Malcolm Turnbull speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese starts his fourth full day of campaigning in South Australia, while Peter Dutton is on his way to Melbourne to announce plans to scrap a major rail project. Follow live.

title.children: 'Get off your knees':Turnbull urges leaders to stand up to Trump

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaking at a press conference.

props.synopsis: An updated list of grievances published by the United States trade office has set its sights on Australia's pharmaceutical sector, biosecurity protections and laws requiring the social media giants to pay for news.

title.children: Albanese won't budge on key US grievances, as Trump's 'liberation day' looms

image.altText: Sliding glass doors into a building with the words Reserve Bank of Australia written above.

props.synopsis: The ASX rises after a recovery on Wall Street, as the Reserve Bank keeps interest rates steady. It follows a volatile night for global markets, with heavy falls in Europe as traders await Trump's tariff reveal. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Aussie dollar, ASX remain higher as RBA stays on hold

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australia's stock market closes 1 pc higher
Would lower mortgage serviceability buffers worry the RBA?
RBA board did not discuss a rate cut

image.altText: People walking past the outside of the Reserve Bank of Australia in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The RBA board has kept its cash rate target unchanged at 4.1 per cent this month, after delivering its first cut since November 2020 at its Feburary meeting.

title.children: Reserve Bank leaves interest rates on hold at April meeting

image.altText: a group of politicians on a podium in front of a blue backdrop

props.synopsis: The opposition leader has slammed the prime minister's response to a Chinese research ship south of Australia, saying he believes the vessel is gathering intelligence and mapping the route of Australia's undersea cables.

title.children: Dutton says Chinese research ship mapping undersea cables along Australia's coastline

image.altText: Elephants in the water.

props.synopsis: Botswana's elephant population has doubled in recent decades, creating chaos for many who live alongside them.

title.children: An African nation has become a victim of its own conservation triumph

image.altText: A home buyer looks at documents. In the foreground of the image is a model house and keys.

props.synopsis: The Coalition is promising to relax home lending rules if elected, to allow prospective buyers to borrow more. But will this actually make it easier for first home buyers to break into the market?

title.children: The Coalition's latest pitch for first home buyers benefits existing owners more

image.altText: Qasseem lies on his back on a stretcher, with his legs and lower torso under a blanket and a purple cloth covering his face.

props.synopsis: Some of the worst violence in years drives members of a minority sect linked to fallen Syrian leader Bashar al-Assad to flee for their lives, and many worry the new government is not serious about punishing those responsible.

title.children: Anger as fallen Syrian regime turns to deadly violence

image.altText: A cigarette with the words "causes 16 cancers" on the filter

props.synopsis: We have a "relatively low" smoking rate, but the Cancer Council says 66 Australians are still dying from smoking-related illness every day.

title.children: Menthol cigarettes banned and every stick to hold a warning

image.altText: Woman in bed with a cold blowing her nose.

props.synopsis: A record number of influenza cases has been recorded in Australia, jumping 50 per cent from the same period last year. Experts are predicting flu season to come earlier than usual.

title.children: Record high Influenza cases confirmed as experts predict early flu season

image.altText: An aerial view of vast flooding in the outback.

props.synopsis: Record-breaking rainfall has drenched outback Queensland in the past week and authorities are scrambling to repair broken levees.

title.children: Worst flooding in 50 years ravages outback Queensland

image.altText: People in costumes perform onstage at the 13th Confucius Institute Conference in Chengdu

props.synopsis: Australia's leading universities cut ties with Confucius Institutes, but don’t cite concerns of foreign interference.

title.children: Confucius Institutes quietly disappear from six Australian universities

image.altText: A Chinese aircraft carrier seen on an open ocean horizon line from afar

props.synopsis: China has launched joint military exercises in waters surrounding Taiwan, which it says serve as a 'severe warning and forceful containment against Taiwan independence'.

title.children: China launches military drills around Taiwan as independence warning

image.altText: A blonde woman surrounded by cameras and men in suits

props.synopsis: Marine Le Pen and her National Rally party were convicted of embezzling funds allocated for European Parliamentary aides. Here's how it unfolded.

title.children: EU funds for political jobs behind Le Pen conviction in France

image.altText: A made-up poster showing Clive Palmer, Gina Rinehart, Peter Dutton and Michael McCormack in Nazi uniforms.

props.synopsis: Michael McCormack says images in a country NSW shop window depicting himself, Opposition Leader Peter Dutton, Clive Palmer and Gina Rinehart as Nazis are "vile" and "abhorrent".

title.children: Posters of politicians and billionaires as Nazis slammed as 'vile'

image.altText: A still from CCTV footage shows three security guards (faces blurred) surrounding a man on the ground

props.synopsis: Footage emerges of three government-funded security guards kicking and stomping on a man on a Darwin street.

title.children: NT pseudo-cops filmed kicking a man's head like a soccer ball

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: The financial regulator says household debt is already high and its "serviceability buffer" is appropriate. The Coalition says the high buffer is out of date and relaxing it would help more first home buyers into their own place.

title.children: Coalition promises to relax home lending rules, against regulator's urging

image.altText: Kid Rock in a bright red suit with stars stands next to Donald Trump sitting at a desk in the oval office.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump signed the directive in the Oval Office, with singer Kid Rock standing next to him in an American flag-themed outfit.

title.children: Trump joined by Kid Rock as he signs ticket scalping executive order

image.altText: A man in a white shirt and a necklace with a cross.

props.synopsis: Pope Francis approves the canonisation of Peter To Rot as PNG's first saint, not long after being released from hospital.

title.children: Preacher held in Japanese prison to become PNG's first saint

image.altText: A row of guns lined up in a collector's home.

props.synopsis: The WA government offers financial compensation to owners of now-illegal rapid release firearms and introduces another general buyback scheme, as the minister apologises for the "trouble" caused by the scheme.

title.children: Minister apologises for 'trouble' of WA gun laws as new buyback scheme announced

image.altText: Flames and smoke coming from a low scrubby area

props.synopsis: The South Australian Country Fire Service has issued a watch and act alert for an uncontrolled bushfire burning east of Robe, in the state's south-east.

title.children: Uncontrolled bushfire burning east of Robe in south-east SA

image.altText: A space capsule in orbit above the globe

props.synopsis: Australian amateur radio enthusiasts are ready to be part of history after the first polar space mission — with an Australian astronaut on board — blasted off today.

title.children: Ham radio operators standing by for contact with polar orbit mission

image.altText: Nicole Kidman with a neutral expression stands in what looks like a kitchen.

props.synopsis: Nicole Kidman reprises the role of a well-coiffed tradwife beginning to see past the idyll of her cushioned middle-class existence in eerie new film Holland.

title.children: Nicole Kidman is once again a domestic goddess with a secret in new film

image.altText: Three middle aged white men tinted blue, green and red

props.synopsis: Currently two major and two minor parties dominate the landscape of federal politics. But what do they actually stand for?

title.children: What do Australian political parties actually stand for?

image.altText: James May, in a yellow jacket, looking at the camera in front of an image showing an old map and a picture of the Earth.

props.synopsis: James May has confirmed that he, Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond have split, saying a reunion between the famous motoring trio is now highly unlikely.

title.children: 'We have disbanded': James May on Top Gear, The Grand Tour and his new live show

image.altText: Machine gun

props.synopsis: A 45-year-old man and a 16-year-old are due to appear in court charged in connection with the alleged supply of homemade guns in south-east New South Wales.

title.children: Man and teen charged after homemade guns, 3D printer seized by police

image.altText: A woman wearing Islamic headdress crying in a town square, supported by other women.

props.synopsis: The Palestinian Red Crescent Society and Gaza's civil defence agency staff disappeared last week, after the Israel Defense Forces opened fire on a convoy of ambulances and fire trucks.

title.children: Bodies of Palestinian medics and emergency crews recovered in southern Gaza

image.altText: A man in green kicks another man in the head with soccer players around them

props.synopsis: A Peruvian soccer game took an unexpected turn when a referee defended himself by kicking an individual who rushed to attack him.

title.children: Soccer ref nails pitch invader with MMA-style kick to head

image.altText: red rocky outcrops covered in green vegetation

props.synopsis: Police have confirmed the body of a missing man last seen swimming near Kununurra has been found.

title.children: Search for 23yo man missing at a Kimberley waterhole ends in tragedy

image.altText: Erin Hunt sitting on a bench chair

props.synopsis: Facing your abuser in court as a victim-survivor of domestic and family violence is daunting and difficult, to say the least. It's Erin Hunt's job to make that easier.

title.children: I support victim-survivors in court. Their strength keeps me going

image.altText: A woman and man and their daughter sitting on their front step smiling - a skateboard behind them.

props.synopsis: For Stacey Donchi, a shared love of Dungeons and Dragons, Star Wars and board games with Steve Lyons far outweighed her family and friends' concerns about her dating a man with no legs and one arm.

title.children: When Stacey started dating Steve, she let go of her preconceptions

image.altText: Artist impression of AFL match underway at proposed Macquarie Point stadium

props.synopsis: Key players react to the release of a scathing Tasmanian Planning Commission draft report which outlines a slew of concerns with the Macquarie Point stadium project.

title.children: Fallout continues in wake of damning assessment of Hobart stadium plan

image.altText: Sam Draper, Noah Anderson and Will Ashcroft

props.synopsis: A strange routine keeps paying off for Sam Draper, and the Lions remain composed playing from behind as the Suns continue to reap rewards from the AFL's helping hand. Here's what we learned from round three of the AFL season.

title.children: Bomber's strange routine works as the AFL-created monster sets up Queensland collision course
